hints.content:
We can think of $\purpleC{54}$ as $\purpleC{5\text{ tens}}$ and $\purpleC{4 \text{ ones}}$.  

We can think of $\blueD{22}$ as $\blueD{2\text{ tens}}$ and $\blueD{2\text{ ones}}$.

$\phantom{=}\purpleC{54}+\blueD{22}$

$=\purpleC{5\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{4\text{ ones}}+\blueD{2\text{ tens}}+\blueD{2\text{ ones}}$

$= \purpleC{5\text{ tens}}+\blueD{2\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{4\text{ ones}}+\blueD{2\text{ ones}}$
The answer: $5 \text{ tens}+2\text{ tens} +4 \text{ ones}+2 \text{ ones}$
